results.title: Frontline
results.brief_description: Frontline is an Australian comedy television series which satirised Australian television current affairs programmes and reporting. It ran for three series of 13 half-hour episodes and was broadcast on ABC TV in 1994, 1995 and 1997.

constellations_other.name: Bob Connolly
constellations_other.description: Australian audiences just can't seem to get enough of exploring local governments, bureaucracy and politics, whether that's through documentaries or biting social satire.

constellations_other.name: Newsreel to nightly news
constellations_other.description: For decades, newsreel companies covered the news, providing weekly stories of current events, sport, and entertainment to audiences at the cinema, and establishing the format that would be taken up by television and the nightly news.

results.description: Frontline is an Australian comedy television series which satirised Australian television current affairs programmes and reporting. It ran for three series of 13 half-hour episodes and was broadcast on ABC TV in 1994, 1995 and 1997.
description_for_label: Frontline is an Australian comedy television series which satirised Australian television current affairs programmes and reporting. It ran for three series of 13 half-hour episodes and was broadcast on ABC TV in 1994, 1995 and 1997.

results.title: Front Line
results.brief_description: Front Line is a 1981 Australian documentary film directed by David Bradbury. It follows the career of Tasmanian-born combat cameraman Neil Davis, particularly his time in South Vietnam and Cambodia in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Documentary Feature.

constellations_other.name: Hell no, we won't go
constellations_other.description: The cultural, social, psychological and political effects of the Vietnam War have been explored through cinematic classics, musicals and comedies.

results.description: Front Line is a 1981 Australian documentary film directed by David Bradbury. It follows the career of Tasmanian-born combat cameraman Neil Davis, particularly his time in South Vietnam and Cambodia in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Documentary Feature.

results.title: Fresh Guacamole
results.brief_description: In this follow-up to his stop-motion hit Western Spaghetti, director PES transforms familiar objects into Fresh Guacamole.
results.description: In this follow-up to his stop-motion hit Western Spaghetti, director PES transforms familiar objects into Fresh Guacamole.

results.title: Freddy's Dead: The Final Nightmare
results.brief_description: Just when you thought it was safe to sleep, Freddy Krueger returns in this sixth installment of the Nightmare on Elm Street films, as psychologist Maggie Burroughs, tormented by recurring nightmares, meets a patient with the same horrific dreams. Their quest for answers leads to a certain house on Elm Street — where the nightmares become reality.
results.description: Just when you thought it was safe to sleep, Freddy Krueger returns in this sixth installment of the Nightmare on Elm Street films, as psychologist Maggie Burroughs, tormented by recurring nightmares, meets a patient with the same horrific dreams. Their quest for answers leads to a certain house on Elm Street — where the nightmares become reality.

results.title: Frankenweenie
results.brief_description: When a car hits young Victor’s pet dog Sparky, Victor brings him back to life the only way he knows how. But when the bolt-necked “monster” wreaks havoc and terror, Victor has to convince his neighbours that Sparky’s still the good, loyal friend he was.

constellations_other.name: Stop-motion and animation superstars
constellations_other.description: Despite the ease of new technology and a legacy going back to the beginning of cinema, stop-motion animation techniques are as popular as ever.

results.description: When a car hits young Victor’s pet dog Sparky, Victor decides to bring him back to life the only way he knows how. But when the bolt-necked “monster” wreaks havoc and terror in the hearts of Victor’s neighbors, he has to convince them that Sparky’s still the good, loyal friend he was.

But when the bolt-necked “monster” wreaks havoc and terror in the hearts of Victor’s neighbors, he has to convince them that Sparky’s still the good, loyal friend he was.

results.title: Four Corners
results.brief_description: Four Corners is Australia’s longest-running investigative journalism/current affairs television program. It addresses a single issue in depth each week, showing either a locally produced program or a relevant documentary from overseas.

constellations_other.name: 1960s television
constellations_other.description: After its debut in the fifties, Australians rapidly became enthusiastic television viewers in the sixties as American imports started to be mixed with notable local productions.

constellations_other.name: Nightly news and laughs
constellations_other.description: Throughout the decades on Australian screens, comedy and news have often gone hand-in-hand.

results.description:
Four Corners is Australia’s longest-running investigative journalism/current affairs television program. Broadcast on ABC1 in Australia, it premiered on 19 August 1961 and celebrated its 60th anniversary in 2021. Founding producer Robert Raymond and his successor Allan Ashbolt did much to set the ongoing tone of the program.

Based on the Panorama concept, the program addresses a single issue in depth each week, showing either a locally produced program or a relevant documentary from overseas. The program has won many awards for investigative journalism, and broken many high-profile stories. A notable early example of this was the show’s epoch-making 1962 exposé on the appalling living conditions endured by many Aboriginal Australians living in rural New South Wales.
description_for_label:
Four Corners is Australia’s longest-running investigative journalism/current affairs television program. Broadcast on ABC1 in Australia, it premiered on 19 August 1961 and celebrated its 60th anniversary in 2021. Founding producer Robert Raymond and his successor Allan Ashbolt did much to set the ongoing tone of the program.

Based on the Panorama concept, the program addresses a single issue in depth each week, showing either a locally produced program or a relevant documentary from overseas. The program has won many awards for investigative journalism, and broken many high-profile stories. A notable early example of this was the show’s epoch-making 1962 exposé on the appalling living conditions endured by many Aboriginal Australians living in rural New South Wales.

results.title: Fosse/Verdon
results.creator_credit: FX Productions, Fox 21 Television Studios, West Egg Studios, 5000 Broadway Productions, Pyrrhic Victory Productions, Joel Fields Productions, Old 320 Sycamore, The VerdonFosse Legacy, Adam Bernstein, Minkie Spiro and Jessica Yu
results.brief_description: Spanning five decades, FOSSE/VERDON explores the singular romantic and creative partnership between Bob Fosse and Gwen Verdon

constellations_other.name: Viral music videos
constellations_other.description: Gotye's 'Somebody that I used to know' was one of the internet's most viral music videos, seconded only to Queen Bey's 'Singles Ladies'.

results.creator_credit_for_label: FX Productions, Fox 21 Television Studios, West Egg Studios, 5000 Broadway Productions, Pyrrhic Victory Productions, Joel Fields Productions, Old 320 Sycamore, The VerdonFosse Legacy, Adam Bernstein, Minkie Spiro and Jessica Yu
results.description: The story of the romantic and creative partnership between Bob Fosse and Gwen Verdon. He was a filmmaker and one of theater’s most influential choreographers and directors; she was the greatest Broadway dancer of all time. Together, they changed the face of American entertainment — at a perilous cost.
description_for_label: The story of the romantic and creative partnership between Bob Fosse and Gwen Verdon. He was a filmmaker and one of theater’s most influential choreographers and directors; she was the greatest Broadway dancer of all time. Together, they changed the face of American entertainment — at a perilous cost.

results.title: Formula 1: Drive to Survive
results.brief_description: Drivers, managers and team owners live life in the fast lane — both on and off the track — during one cutthroat season of Formula 1 racing.
results.description: Drivers, managers and team owners live life in the fast lane — both on and off the track — during one cutthroat season of Formula 1 racing.

results.title: Following
results.creator_credit: Next Wave Films, Christopher Nolan, Emma Thomas and Jeremy Theobald
results.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1999
results.brief_description: Bill, an idle, unemployed and aspiring writer, walks the crowded streets of London following randomly chosen strangers, a seemingly innocent activity that becomes dangerous when he crosses paths with a mysterious character…

constellations_other.name: Amateur hour
constellations_other.description: Early sound equipment allowed filmmakers and amateurs alike the ability to experiment often with affordable 16mm film.

results.title: Flipper
results.brief_description: Many kids might say their best friend is a puppy or a pony. But for 12-year-old Sandy, the most special pet of all is the exuberant dolphin he rescues and who returns the favor by rescuing Sandy from sharks.The dolphin named Flipper first swam into the world’s minds and hearts in this 1963 film starring Chuck Connors and Luke Halpin as Sandy (a role he would continue in the 1964-68 TV series that followed.) James B. Clark, a long-time family filmmaker whose credits include “Island of the Blue Dolphins” and “My Side of the Mountain,” directs the story of hard times (Hurricane Hazel and its aftermath) and joy (Sandy’s dolphin-powered rides through the waves). And two fins up for Mitzie, the animal star who plays flipper.
